case_title: In Re: Application Filed by Mr. Sultan Ali Lakhani for Grant of Certified Copies of Statement of Assets and Liabilities in Respect of Mrs. Nasreen Jalil, Senator

accussed_details.name: Mrs. Nasreen Jalil
allegation: Failure to submit accurate statement of assets and liabilities under Section 25 of the Senate (Election) Act, 1975

complaint_summary: Application filed by Mr. Sultan Ali Lakhani requesting certified copies of the statement of assets and liabilities submitted by Mrs. Nasreen Jalil, alleging potential inaccuracies and corrupt practices under the Senate (Election) Act, 1975.
investigation_summary: The Chief Election Commissioner reviewed the application and heard arguments from both parties regarding the public nature of the statement of assets and liabilities and its relevance to election petitions.

judgment_summary.decision: Certified copy of statement of assets and liabilities to be supplied to the applicant upon payment of prescribed fee.
reasoning: Statement of assets and liabilities is a public document under Article 85 of Qanun-e-Shahadat.
Granting certified copies aligns with constitutional duties to guard against corrupt practices.
No legal provision explicitly prohibits inspection or granting certified copies.

Decision_or_verdict: Certified copy of the statement of assets and liabilities to be provided to the applicant.
legal_arguments: Section 25 of the Senate (Election) Act, 1975 mandates submission of assets and liabilities by successful candidates.
Section 58 defines corrupt practices, including submission of false statements.
Section 49 outlines grounds for declaring elections void due to corrupt practices.
Section 36 specifies the contents of election petitions, requiring precise statements of material facts.
Article 218 and 219 of the Constitution emphasize the duty of the Election Commission to guard against corrupt practices.
Article 85 of Qanun-e-Shahadat defines public documents.
assets: Statement of assets and liabilities filed by Mrs. Nasreen Jalil
key_issues: Whether the statement of assets and liabilities is a public document.
Whether certified copies of such statements can be granted under the Senate (Election) Act, 1975.

maxims.Suppressio veri, suggestio falsi: Suppression of truth is equivalent to the suggestion of falsehood.

legal_terms.Corrupt Practices: Acts defined under Section 58 of the Senate (Election) Act, 1975.

words_and_phrases.Statement of Assets and Liabilities: A document required under Section 25 of the Senate (Election) Act, 1975.

summary_vector_notes: Application for certified copies of assets and liabilities statement filed by Mrs. Nasreen Jalil. Judgment emphasizes public nature of the document under Qanun-e-Shahadat and its relevance to election petitions under the Senate (Election) Act, 1975.

key_points: Statement of assets and liabilities is a public document under Article 85 of Qanun-e-Shahadat.
Necessary for filing election petitions under sections 36 and 49 of the Senate Election Act.
Supports transparency and guards against corrupt practices as per constitutional duties.
Statement of assets and liabilities is not a public document.
No express provision in the Act for granting certified copies.

Senate_Election_Act_1975.section_25: Declaration of result of election and submission of statement of assets and liabilities.
Senate_Election_Act_1975.section_58: Definition of corrupt practices including submission of false statements.
Senate_Election_Act_1975.section_49: Grounds for declaring election of returned candidate void.

constitution_articles.article_218: Election Commission duties to ensure fair elections.
constitution_articles.article_219: Duties of Commissioner including organizing Senate elections.
